Poker.logic

Class HandRanking

  • java.lang.Object
    • Poker.logic.HandRanking

  • public class HandRanking
extends java.lang.Object
    Static utility class that maps each rank of poker hand to a lambda which calculates it based on 2 maps provided to the function The map can then be iterated through and all methods can be applied to the current player hand

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.util.LinkedHashMap<PokerHands,HandRankingCalculator> map
      A LinkedHashMap is needed as the order of assignment of the lambdas to the map should be preserved

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HandRanking() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static javafx.util.Pair<PokerHands,java.lang.Integer> getHandRank(Player player) 
      private static int pointsRanker(PokerHands handRank, int cardsPoint)
      Ranking algorithm used for hand ranking the total points are calculated with a weighted sum: the hand rank has a magnitude of a 100:1 in respect to the card points the card points are then used to distinguish between hands with the same rank

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • HandRanking

        public HandRanking()

    • Method Detail

      • pointsRanker

        private static int pointsRanker(PokerHands handRank,
                                int cardsPoint)
        Ranking algorithm used for hand ranking the total points are calculated with a weighted sum: the hand rank has a magnitude of a 100:1 in respect to the card points the card points are then used to distinguish between hands with the same rank
        Parameters:
        handRank - Rank of the hand
        cardsPoint - The total points of the user's hand (note: this is not a sum of all the cards' points, but rather a sum of the cards that are valid towards the rank and thus have to be calculated individually for each rank

      • getHandRank

        public static javafx.util.Pair<PokerHands,java.lang.Integer> getHandRank(Player player)
